audio_caption: The audio begins with an upbeat hip-hop intro with a piano melody. A man speaks with a slightly regretful tone, noting that "before Ben Simmons quit on the 76ers, he was an NBA All-Star." Then, the music transitions to a faster tempo. The speaker continues, saying "before Ben Simmons had the worst contract in NBA history, he was a perennial defensive player of the year candidate." As the tempo shifts up again, he remarks that "before Ben Simmons looked like a total disaster on the Nets," he looked like an "all-time NBA generational talent." The music fades and the speaker asks "what in the world happened?"

A male narrator with a neutral tone introduces a figure by name and shares biographical details about their upbringing and entry into basketball, emphasizing their natural talent and early achievements. He includes a fun fact about the person's past love for rugby and mentions their dominance in Australia before joining Monteverde Academy, eventually gaining recognition as a top prospect and being compared to basketball legends. Light, unobtrusive background music adds atmosphere to the narration.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker, who is discussing the downfall of someone named Simmons in professional sports, suggesting that Simmons' early accolades and comparison to legendary players led to a decline. The speaker has a contemplative tone. There are no distinct background sounds present.

The audio clip begins with a male voice describing Ben Simmons' college career as "a total disaster", stating that he attended LSU and seemed too cool for school, and that he likely didn't want to be there. The speaker notes the NBA's requirement for players to spend a year out of high school, adding that Simmons "just winged it" and looked like he didn't want to be there, followed by mention of academic controversies and that Simmons had a low GPA and reportedly skipped class. The tone is critical and analytical, and the speaker suggests that it was all a "big joke" to Simmons.

The audio starts with a man speaking in a casual, conversational tone about basketball player Ben Simmons. He suggests Simmons "didn't want to be there" and "you can't just essentially quit on your team." He mentions a team that "didn't even make the national tournament," calling it a "red flag". The speaker notes it was ironic because some of those early events foreshadowed the problems Simmons faces today. Background music plays softly, setting a somber mood.

The clip begins with a man speaking in a calm, informative tone about Ben Simmons and how he was drafted number one overall, even though he had character issues. He references Brandon Ingram, Jalen Brown, and Joel Embiid. The speaker transitions to discuss Simmons' injury and his subsequent Rookie of the Year award, despite some controversy. He summarizes that the team then went 52 and 30 and lost in the second round.

The clip begins with a single speaker discussing Ben Simmons becoming an All-Star and gaining recognition as a defensive player, noting the 76ers' record and Jimmy Butler's mid-season addition, delivered in an informational tone.

The audio clip features a male speaker with a slightly conversational tone, discussing a basketball team. He notes that the team was a threat, but "lost" against an "all-time Kawhi buzzer-beater," followed by Jimmy Butler leaving and the team not being great. He then mentions a bubble year, an injured Simmons, and a loss to the Celtics, finishing with the observation that Ben Simmons' stats remained stagnant throughout his career, which he considers a "huge red flag."

The clip begins with a male speaker discussing an "absolute tragedy" that he believes ruined a basketball player's career. He speaks in a conversational, slightly somber tone, describing the player passing up an open layup because he was "scared to get fouled." He highlights the player's inability to shoot free throws and how this moment destroyed his career. The speaker references criticism from others and implies the team broke some kind of code. The speech is followed by background music, seemingly hip-hop, playing quietly.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing the Sixers' franchise and Ben Simmons' career, suggesting the team never forced or taught him to shoot, and the speaker's tone is critical. He describes Simmons requesting a trade with multiple years left on his contract and the character issues he faced in college. The speaker recounts Simmons' reaction of showing up to practice and not wanting to be there. There was controversy around the team sending him home and his mental state to play. The speaker continues about the slipper slope the Sixers believed Simmons was using his mental health for financial gain, and he was being fined again and again. He ends by explaining that the Sixers didn't want to trade him due to his market value.

The clip starts with a male voice stating that the 2022 trade deadline approaches. Then, the same voice mentions that James Harden asked for a trade. Finally, the voice states the Sixers traded Ben for Harden. The speaker speaks clearly with an informative tone.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker summarizing the problems with Ben Simmons, mentioning his mental health issues, back problems, and the Nets being swept in the first round. He sounds incredulous and questions how Simmons could have injured his back without playing. He claims he doesn't have the answer because nobody knows, finding the situation disturbing, and points out the character issues. He then briefly mentions the potential for Simmons to have a great year, but jokes about Kyrie Irving requesting a trade, then KD also requesting one. He then suggests this season is doomed before it even starts, calling the situation of three mentally fragile superstars a recipe for disaster. Moving on, the speaker notes that Ben Simmons does not look like himself all season, then mentions someone getting poked in the eye and claiming a knee injury, remarking, "No joke. Take a look" before concluding with "again, character issues."

The clip begins with a male speaker excitedly discussing a basketball team, stating, "surprisingly, everyone is locked in". His tone shifts to disappointment as he mentions "Kyrie just asked out again", and subsequently "Kevin Durant asked out again". The speaker is then replaced by a quiet beep sound.

The clip begins with a male speaker expressing disappointment about a basketball player, stating, "Ben Simmons today is even 75% of the player he was on Philly." He conveys that the player is struggling and lists the starting lineup of his current team. The tone is critical and somewhat melancholic as he summarizes the player's ineffectiveness, noting he isn't "as good as any of these guys right now," concluding with "This is just plain sad."

The audio clip starts with a male speaker stating that "at the beginning of the video, Ben is averaging three points a game in February." He sounds dismayed, describing it as "heartbreaking," wondering how someone could go from being an NBA All-Star to "being this bad," noting that he's "running out of words to describe it." The speech is relatively clear with a tone of frustration.

The clip opens with a male speaker lamenting Ben Simmons' character flaws, citing that "character issues have led up to all of this" and suggesting he was "too cool for school." The speaker emphasizes Simmons' reluctance to improve his shooting and lack of confidence on the court. A musical score plays faintly behind the speaker. The male speaker continues, suggesting he "throws a tantrum when he faces any little criticism." The music and speaker both drop in volume as the clip ends.

The clip opens with a somber statement about someone's rise leading to an "inevitable decline," spoken with a reflective tone. A different male voice then presents the narrative of "the guy without actually doing anything", who was too good in college, and told not to shoot, and ultimately "folds and quits." The speaker concludes that people now deem this person a "bust". The tone is critical and judgmental.
